speaker: SCULLY
line: Time passes in moments... moments which, rushing past define the path of a life just as surely as they lead towards its end. How rarely do we stop to examine that path, to see the reasons why all things happen, to consider whether the path we take in life is our own making or simply one into which we drift with eyes closed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But what if we could stop, pause to take stock of each precious moment before it passes? Might we then see the endless forks in the road that have shaped a life? And, seeing those choices, choose another path?

speaker: MUSIC
line: "See, the storm has broken in the middle of the night nothing left here for me, it's washed away the rain pushes the buildings aside... "

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got the lab to rush the results of...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I said, I got the lab to rush the results of the Szczesny autopsy, if you're interested.

speaker: MULDER
line: I heard you, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Szczesny did indeed drown but not as the result of the inhalation of ectoplasm as you so vehemently suggested.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what else could she possibly have drowned in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Margarita mix, upchucked with about 40 ounces of Corcovado Gold tequila which, as it turns out she and her friends rapidly consumed in the woods while trying to reenact the Blair Witch Project.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I think that demands a little deeper investigation, don't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I don't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it doesn't matter. We got bigger fish to fry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have a seat, Scully. Check this out. Is that beautiful or what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Crop circles, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Computer-generated crop circles. It's a fractal image predicted by a computer program and using data of every known occurrence of the phenomena over the past 40 years.

speaker: MULDER
line: What most people don't realize is that, since 1991...

speaker: MULDER
line: ... there's been a dramatic increase in size and complexity of circle design. That's when the Mandelbrot Set appeared in England.

speaker: MULDER
line: A series of geometrically perfect rings appearing almost impossibly overnight in a field near Cambridge.

speaker: MULDER
line: But that was merely prelude of what was to come. Three years later, in 1994 even more complex formations occurred simultaneously on opposite ends of the English countryside with the Mandelbrot Set, were it still there, at its center. Then, in 1997, even more complex formations occurred...

speaker: MULDER
line: ... and I'm not wearing any pants right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm?

speaker: MULDER
line: You're not listening.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess I just don't see the point.

speaker: MULDER
line: The point is is that a computer program has shown us that these are not just random, happenstance coincidental occurrences and that same program has predicted that in just 48 hours even more complex formations are going to be laid down in a field near Avebury-- 48 hours, Scully-- but I wouldn't mind getting there earlier if you don't mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Getting where?

speaker: MULDER
line: England - I got two tickets on a 5:30 flight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I still have to go over to the hospital and-and-and finish the final paperwork on the autopsy you had me do. And, to be honest, it's Saturday and I wouldn't mind, I don't know, taking a bath?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what the hell does that mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What it means, Mulder, is I'm not interested in tracking down some sneaky farmers who happened to ace geometry in high school.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And besides, I mean... what could you possibly get out of this? Or learn? I mean, it's not even remotely FBI-related.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll just cancel your ticket.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks for lunch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, we're always running. We're always chasing the next big thing. Why don't you ever just stay still?

speaker: MULDER
line: I wouldn't know what I'd be missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My name is Dana Scully and I was told I could pick up a postmortem folder for a Ms. Szczesny here. It's, uh, for the FBI.

speaker: NURSE 2
line: Let's see...

speaker: NURSE 2
line: Oh!

speaker: NURSE 2
line: You just sign here, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, um... I was given the wrong test results. This, uh, x-ray marked "D. Waterston" was in the envelope marked "Szczesny." I was expecting autopsy results.

speaker: NURSE 2
line: Oh, I'm sorry. They must've gotten switched. Sorry for the inconvenience.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Is the, um... is the "D. Waterston" that was on the x-ray is that a Dr. Daniel Waterston?

speaker: NURSE
line: Let's see: Waterston, Waterston... Yes, it is. Admitted yesterday, coronary care unit, room 306.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: I'm sorry. I don't know what else to say. Everything appears to be as it should under the circumstances so don't worry. If you'd like, I can show you the hospital cafeteria.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Uh, yeah, I guess... Yeah, okay.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Are there phones down there, too? I need to make some phone calls.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Excuse me...

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Can I help you with something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um, I'm sorry. I'm Dr. Scully. I-I was just in the hospital and...

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Can we step into the hallway?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: I'm Dr. Waterston's cardiologist, Paul Kopeikan. Did you say your name was Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, yes, Dana Scully.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Dr. Waterston's mentioned you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, you must be mistaken.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: No, you were a student of his, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He has a heart condition?

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Dr. Waterston came in yesterday with severe chest pains and he ordered us to do an echocardiogram and a biopsy because he'd had symptoms of an upper respiratory infection the week before. Fortunately, it was the right call.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then it's serious.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: But treatable. I have to wake him up soon, if you'd care to...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's all right. But, uh, thanks for your time.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: He must've been a wonderful teacher. I've been following his work on constrictive pericarditis for years now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes... he's a remarkable man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: You came to see him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, who is this?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Margaret Waterston.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maggie. Is everything all right?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Well, that depends, doesn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Whatever. Dr. Kopeikan told my father you were here and now he wants to see you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Look, he asked me to call, so I'm calling.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, Maggie. I don't know if I've got time.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Don't know if you have the time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maggie, can you hang on a second? I have another call coming through.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Listen... it's your choice, but if you come it doesn't mean I accept you being in his life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MAN ON OLD BLACK AND WHITE MOVIE ON TV
line: I'll never see you again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MAN ON OLD TV MOVIE
line: You're breaking my heart.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, you're there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, aren't you supposed to be on a plane?

speaker: MULDER
line: I got a 5:30 flight, remember?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. Guess I lost track of time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen, uh, the reason I called-- am I catching you at a bad time?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I just walked in. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, there's this group in D.C. that is researching crop circles. They've got a totally different set of coordinates from the one that I got already.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm not going.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got to ask you a favor. One of the researchers lives out near the hospital and they've got these sensitive photos and data and stuff that they won't fax to me so I was just wondering if you would just, maybe go over there and, you know, and get it and put it in the bureau pouch for me...

speaker: MULDER
line: Speak to me, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm out for the evening, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, um... why don't you leave that address on my answering machine and, uh, I'll try for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry. I-I have the wrong room.

speaker: RED-HAIRED WOMAN
line: It's okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: So I have to lock eyes with the Devil for you to grace me with your presence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Surely not the Devil.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you feeling, Daniel?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: It's a real drag when the body doesn't want to play anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're extremely lucky you called that diagnosis.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Luck has nothing to do with it, Dana. It's what doctors do everyday. You may have forgotten that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Daniel...

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, how did you happen to be here in Washington?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: That's a long story.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: How's the FBI?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that why you wanted to see me? To remind me once again what a bad choice I made?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Believe me. My motivation is far more selfish than that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You scare me, Daniel.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I know. I scare you...... because I represent that which is ingrained not only in your mind but in your heart-- that which you secretly long for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You never accepted my reason for leaving.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: It wasn't a reason, it was an excuse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you understood why.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I can't believe the FBI is a passion. Not like medicine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry I came.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I know how difficult it must have been for you... just walking through that door but you wouldn't have come if you didn't want to and that says something, doesn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was just about to leave you a message. Listen, I got that, uh, that address that I wanted you to go to for me. It's a woman you're going to be dealing with. She's affiliated with The American Taoist Healing Center.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She researches crop circles?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't roll your eyes, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder you want me to...?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Scully, you there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. I'm...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were...

speaker: WOMAN
line: ... at the hospital today.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. That's strange. Um, I-I'm Agent Scully. I'm-I'm here on behalf of my partner.

speaker: WOMAN
line: About my research.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For the FBI, as odd as that may sound.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Right. I'm Colleen Azar. Would you like to come in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, thank you. I think I need some fresh air.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Are you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I... I mean, yes, I-I'm just a little shaken. I... a near car accident, I think. It's nothing, really.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: A car accident isn't "nothing."

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: In my experience they're often the end results of us not paying attention to something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I-I don't mean to be rude but I really don't have much time.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Sure. I'll go get my papers.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: You think what we do is a little ridiculous, don't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, to be honest, I don't know exactly what it is that you do.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: But you've already formed a judgment about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I really should be going.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: There is a greater intelligence in all things. Accidents-- or near accidents-- often remind us that we need to keep our mind open to the lessons it gives.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: You may want to slow down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Aw, Hurricane Scully has arrived.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was summoned.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Would you please tell the doc here why he should listen to me.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: Sir, we've already agreed to doses of digoxin that are far beyond what I normally recommend.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I guarantee you, Doctor, you're doing it right.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: But I can't be responsible for treatment that might exacerbate your illness. There hasn't even been a double-blind analysis of prednisone's effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Prednisone? That won't complicate cardiac arrhythmia. Not if it's just a short burst.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: There. An informed opinion.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: You come off so rational but maybe you know less than you think.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: She's... been through some difficult times and she's very angry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did she even find out?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: There are things you don't know... things I'm not proud of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What things?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I screwed up, Dana. Things got bad at home after...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bad how?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I haven't been completely honest with you. It was hard for me... when you walked away. Shut down from my family and needless to say, it was very difficult for Barbara.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You divorced.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Only after an interminable period of discomfort for us both.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did you go?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Here. Washington.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Almost ten years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Daniel... you didn't move here for me?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I didn't mean for it to happen this way, of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've come at such a strange time.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: I know, I know. You-you have a life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what I have. I mean... your x-rays were in the wrong envelope. I never would have even known you were here if it wasn't for a mix-up. It's just...

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: What do you want, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want everything I should want at this time of my life. Maybe I want the life I didn't choose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nurse! We have a code in here! Nurse!

speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
line: Code blue, C.C.U.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's in v-fib, get his head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In!

speaker: NURSE
line: In.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 200 joules. All clear?

speaker: NURSE
line: Clear.

speaker: NURSE
line: No pulse, no resp.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 300 joules.

speaker: NURSE 3
line: 300 charge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Clear!

speaker: NURSE
line: Clear.

speaker: NURSE
line: No pulse, no resp.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Epinephrine, one milligram, I.V. Push. Now! Who's paying attention?!

speaker: NURSE 3
line: Ready.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Clear!

speaker: NURSES
line: Clear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have a pulse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Thank you.

speaker: CAROL
line: Hi, can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, I'm looking for Colleen.

speaker: CAROL
line: You want to come in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just need to speak with her that's all.

speaker: CAROL
line: I have to go. Call me if anything interesting happens.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Okay. Bye.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: I'm surprised to see you again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry that I was rude before. I'm a medical doctor and a scientist and, you're right, I don't know what it is that you do... but there was something that you said that I wanted to ask you about.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: About slowing down? Would you like to sit down? Please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have a friend who's ill, and, um... I had a strange feeling today-- just a short while ago, actually-- that he may be dying from a more serious condition than anyone realizes.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: You sense something? Holistic practitioners believe, as do many eastern religions, that living beings exist beyond the physical dimensions of time and space that we're composed of layers of energy and consciousness. You've probably heard it referred to as an "aura."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm... Yes.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Witness this energy field and truths come out that have little to do with scientific proof and much to do with faith.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you saying that I saw?

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Pain. And where there's pain there's a need for healing-- physically, mentally or spiritually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But he has a heart condition.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: When we hold onto shame and guilt and fear it creates imbalance, makes us forget who we are.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: This is difficult for you to accept.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Would you like to have some tea?

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Have you ever had moments when everything gets incredibly clear? When time seems to expand?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. It's so strange.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: You may be more open to things than you think. It's just a matter of what you do with it.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: I used to be a physicist. I was successful in my field working 80-odd hours a week. I thought I was happy. Truth is, I was cut off from the world and from myself. I was literally dying inside. I was in a relationship with Carol, who you met but I was so afraid of what the world and my family and my fellow scientists would think that I told no one. Then, two years ago I was diagnosed with breast cancer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: Mmm... Don't be. It's the cancer that got my attention. It stopped me from being on the self-destructive path I was on. It made me realize I was in a field that had little meaning for me and it's what's allowed me to be happy for what feels like the first time in my life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But how?

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: I was introduced to a healer who helped me see the disease for what it was. It wasn't until I began releasing shame and telling the truth that my cancer went into remission.

speaker: COLLEEN AZAR
line: You still aren't sure. You came here looking for answers and you want something to take back with you. Everything happens for a reason.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Are you happy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry? I was just going up to see your father.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: You can't. He's in a coma.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Since when?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Since about two minutes after you supposedly saved his life.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Do you have any idea the hell you created in our lives?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maggie, to be honest, I left so that there wouldn't be hell in your lives.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Don't try to be reasonable with me. I am so sick of being reasonable. You moved on but we've had to live with what you left behind.

speaker: HEALER
line: What I try to do is clear the body's energy channels-- what we call Chakras-- which can become barriers to a doctor's ability to effectively heal the patient. When these channels are working improperly-- whether from poor physical or emotional health-- the block serves to create conditions for disease. If I can unblock the energy early on then I can prevent the onset or escalation of an illness or provide a place...

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: What's going on here? Dr. Scully, who do you think you are?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have nothing but Dr. Waterston's welfare in mind here.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: You're not his doctor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I understand that. What's taking place here is an alternative approach.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: What's taking place here is a waste of time, Dr. Scully, and I think that Dr. Waterston would be the first to agree with me. Have you considered that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just wanted to help him. It seemed like nothing else was working.

speaker: DR. KOPEIKAN
line: With all due respect that is not for you to assess. That is for me or Dr. Waterston's family to decide.

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: Then let him continue. If it isn't hurting him we should at least be open to it.

speaker: HEALER
line: I'm afraid there's really nothing more I can do at this time. This man, quite frankly, is ready to move on. But something seems to be holding him back. Unfinished business is binding him to the physical plane-- something he needs to release before he can let go.

speaker: MUSIC
line: Broken heart pushing us hear the rain fall See the wind come to my eyes See the storm broken now I'm nothing Speak to me, baby in the middle of the night...

speaker: MUSIC
line: Speak to me...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MAGGIE WATERSTON
line: It's Maggie. I need you to come to the hospital right away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maggie, what's...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Daniel?

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: You think I'd give up so easily?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were slipping away. No one thought you'd come out of this. I'm still in shock.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Imagine my shock when my doctor told me the voodoo ritual you'd arranged for last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was afraid it didn't work.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Of course it didn't work. Don't be absurd. Where do you get this crap?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Daniel, that "crap" may have just saved your life whether you're open to it or not.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: It doesn't matter. I don't want to talk about that. Look at me. I'm going to get well... and we need to talk about... what happens next for us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I spoke at length to Maggie. It's time... that you took responsibility for the hurt you caused in your family. It's no accident that you got sick, Daniel. You've been running from the truth for ten years.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: Dana... It was only to be with you. You were all I lived for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe the reason you're alive now is to make up for that. To make it up to Maggie.

speaker: DANIEL WATERSTON
line: That's Maggie talking, not you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I'm not the same person, Daniel. I wouldn't have known that if I hadn't seen you again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was just looking for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you're supposed to be in England.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing. There was no event. No crop circles. Big waste of time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe sometimes nothing happens for a reason, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing. Come on, I'm make you some tea.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just find it hard to believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What part?

speaker: MULDER
line: The part where I go away for two days and your whole life changes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmm, I didn't say my whole life changed.

speaker: MULDER
line: You speaking to God in a Buddhist temple. God speaking back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmm, and I didn't say that God spoke back. I said that I had some kind of a vision.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, for you, that's like saying you're having David Crosby's baby.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I once considered spending my whole life with this man. What I would have missed.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you can know. I mean, how many different lives would we be leading if we made different choices. We... We don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if there was only one choice and all the other ones were wrong? And there were signs along the way to pay attention to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm. And all the... choices would then lead to this very moment. One wrong turn, and... we wouldn't be sitting here together. Well, that says a lot. That says a lot, a lot, a lot. That's probably more than we should be getting into at this late hour.
